textbooks.title: Introduction to the practice of Statistics
textbooks.author: D. Moore, G. McCabe and B. Craig

textbooks.title: Applied Linear Statistical Models
textbooks.author: Michael Kutner, Christopher Nachtsheim, John Neter, William Li

topics: Testing Hypotheses on Population Means and Proportions
Two Population tests for Means and Proportions
Intro to Risk measures: VaR, CVaR and CoVar

assignments.name: Final Project
assignments.description: Design and produce a project which contains a data component and is applicable to their primary field of study.

policies.attendance: Active participation will be rewarded with bonus points that will count up to 5% of the grade.
policies.late_work: Late assignments will not be accepted under any circumstances without prior notice and permission of the instructor.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: In-person classes held in Hanlon 2 Lab unless otherwise announced.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students must know how to program using R.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Disability Services, Office of Counseling and Psychological Services.

course_info.title: Applied Statistics with applications to Finance

_metadata.course_description: The course prepares students to employ essential ideas and reasoning of applied statistics.
learning_outcomes: Understand and summarize complex data sets through graphs and numerical measures
Calculate estimates of parameters using fundamental statistical methods
Give measures of how good the estimators are by providing confidence intervals or approximate confidence intervals
Apply statistical tests to experimental observations
Estimate and calibrate parameters of mathematical models using real data
Study relationships between two or more random variables
Lay the foundation for a more advanced applied statistical course such as time series analysis, statistical learning, deep learning, and more.
prerequisites: A sound understanding of probability gathered through an undergraduate class such as MA222 or QF 212 or equivalent.
corequisites: FE540 is a co-requisite if such knowledge has gaps.
